Dear Sharon Berkobien:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Youth A was restrained in an unsafe manner.
Investigation I spoke to Complainant 1 and Administrator 1 on 8/21/24. No
additional information was provided.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 8/21/24 at the facility. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was outside with Staff 2 and Staff 3. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was not listening to staff but wasn’t aggressive in
behavior. Staff 1 reported Youth A is young, and he was “playing”
around. Staff 2 was talking on the phone and Youth A kept
repeating, “Let me talk to her.” Staff 3 pushed Youth A away from
Staff 2 about 5 different times. Staff 1 described this action as
extending one arm out towards Youth A and pushing him. Staff 1
reported Youth A fell once during those pushes. After Youth A fell,
he went to hit Staff 3 with a stick he found on the ground. Staff 3
grabbed the stick and pushed Youth A to the ground. Youth A
then got up and ran from them and ended up in the parking lot.
Youth A began touching cars in the parking lot and then Youth A
began to lean against Staff 2’s car. Staff 2 then pushed Youth A
off of the car. Youth A then went towards Staff 3 and started to
kick his legs and attempt to push him. Youth A then attempted to
break a branch off of a tree and Staff 3 pushed him to the ground
by his neck area. Youth A fell to the ground. Staff 3 held him down
on the ground. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was holding the side of his
face down on the ground as well as placed one of his legs on
Youth A’s legs to stop him from moving. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
was still on the phone and was not engaged physically with Youth
A. Staff 3 then released Youth A and Youth A got up and ran
around the building again. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 then
2

attempted to verbally deescalate. Youth A did come back to
baseline.
Both Staff 2 and Staff 3 were administratively placed on leave
after this incident. I attempted phone calls and text messages on
8/21/24, 8/22/24, 9/20/24 and 9/25/24. I did not receive a return
phone call from Staff 3 and Staff 3 no longer works at the facility.
On 9/20/24, I spoke to Staff 2. Staff 2 reported she no longer
works at the facility and did not want to discuss the situation.
Due to law enforcement involvement Youth A was not interviewed
onsite. On 10/1/24 law enforcement gave the approval for outside
interviews.
On 10/23/24, I went to Youth A’s new placement for an interview.
Youth A was not there to be interviewed. On 11/18/24, I went back
to Youth A’s new placement and interviewed him face to face.
Youth A reported he did not remember anything.
Video Reviewed:
I watched the video of the incident on 8/17/24. Only part of the
incident was on video. The time frame available was 11:53am-
11:58am. In the video Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were present
with Youth A. They were outside. Youth A had walked in front of
all the staff. Staff 3 pushed Youth A from the back twice. After the
second push, Youth A turned around and pushed Staff 3. Staff 3
attempted to place Youth A in a standing hold but Youth A slipped
out of the maneuver. Staff 3 then grabbed Youth A by the
shoulders and held him, Youth A was able to remove himself from
this hold and grabbed a stick and hit Staff 3 with it across his
body. Staff 3 pushed Youth A to the ground and grabbed and
threw the stick away from Youth A, while holding Youth A onto the
ground. Staff 3 had held Youth A down to the ground near his
upper shoulder/neck area. The exact area could not be
determined by video.
Documents Reviewed:
• There were no documents of the incident to review. (See
below citation)
• I reviewed personnel files. Staff 1 and Staff 3 had all the
appropriate training and clearances. (See below citation for
Staff 2)
• I reviewed the CPI manual. The agency’s Behavior
Management policy outlines CPI as their restraint model –
3

including Children’s Control Position and a Team Control
Position.
• Youth A’s intake paperwork reported he was 4’6” and
96lbs.
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Staff 3 attempted to restrain
Youth A without the assistance of another, which is unsafe. Staff 3
should have used a Children’s Control Position outlined in CPI. If
this move was not effective, Staff 3 could have used the Team
Control position. Neither one of these holds were attempted.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was alleged to be pushed by Staff 1.
Investigation Staff 1 reported Staff 3 pushed Youth A away from Staff 2 about 5
different times. Staff 1 described this action as extending one arm
out towards Youth A and pushing him. Staff 1 reported Youth A
fell once during those pushes. After Youth A fell, he went to hit
Staff 3 with a stick he found on the ground. Staff 3 grabbed the
stick and pushed Youth A to the ground. Youth A then got up and
ran from them and ended up in the parking lot. Youth A began
touching cars. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 said, “get away from the
fucking cars.” Youth A began to lean against Staff 2’s car. Staff 2
then pushed Youth A off of the car. Youth A then went towards
Staff 3 and started to kick his legs and attempted to push him.
Youth A then attempted to break a branch off of a tree and Staff 3
pushed him to the ground by his neck area.
Both Staff 2 and Staff 3 were administratively placed on leave
after this incident. I attempted phone calls and text messages on
4

8/21/24, 8/22/24, 9/20/24 and 9/25/24. I did not receive a return
phone call from Staff 3 and Staff 3 no longer works at the facility.
On 9/20/24, I spoke to Staff 2. Staff 2 reported she no longer
works at the facility and did not want to discuss the situation.
Youth A was interviewed on11/18/24. Youth A reported he did not
remember anything.
Video Reviewed:
Video of the incident was reviewed on 8/17/24. Only part of
incident was on video. The time frame available was 11:53am-
11:58am. In the video Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 are present with
Youth A. They are outside. Youth A was walking in front of all
staff. Staff 3 pushed Youth A from the back twice. After the
second push, Youth A turned around and pushed Staff 3. Staff 3
attempted to place Youth A in a standing hold but Youth A slipped
out of the maneuver. Staff 3 then grabbed Youth A by the
shoulders and held him, Youth A was able to remove himself from
this hold and grabbed a stick and hit Staff 3 with it across his
body. Staff 3 pushed Youth A to the ground and grabbed and
threw the stick away from Youth A, while holding Youth A onto the
ground. Staff 3 was held Youth A down to the ground near his
upper shoulder/neck area. The exact area could not be
determined by video.
Documents Reviewed:
• Policies surrounding interventions were reviewed, pushing
is identified as an unacceptable manner of intervention.
• There were no documents (including medical) of the
incident to review. (See below citation)
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Based on Staff 1’s interview
and video observation, Staff 3 pushed Youth A multiple times.
Staff 2 also pushed Youth A in the parking lot.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (4) Only the least restrictive intervention necessary to prevent
Description immediate harm to the youth or others may be used and must
5

follow an individualized set of graduated interventions that avoid
the use of restraints.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Youth A was restrained in a situation where a restraint was not
necessary.
Investigation
Staff 1 reported Youth A was outside with himself, Staff 2 and
Staff 3. Staff 1 reported Youth A was not listening to staff but
wasn’t aggressive in behavior. Staff 1 reported Youth A is “young”
so he was “playing” around. Staff 2 was talking on the phone and
Youth A kept repeating, “Let me talk to her.” Staff 3 pushed Youth
A away from Staff 2 about 5 different times. Staff 1 described this
action as extending one arm out towards Youth A and pushing
him. Staff 1 reported Youth A fell once during those pushes. After
Youth A fell, he went to hit Staff 3 with a stick he found on the
ground. Staff 3 grabbed the stick and pushed Youth A to the
ground. Youth A then got up and ran from them and ended up in
the parking lot. Youth A began touching cars and leaned against
Staff 2’s car. Staff 2 then pushed Youth A from the car. Youth A
then went towards Staff 3 and started to kick his legs and attempt
to push him. Youth A then attempted to break a branch off of a
tree and Staff 3 pushed him to the ground by his neck area and
held him there.
Youth A was interviewed on11/18/24. Youth A reported he did not
remember anything.
Video Reviewed:
I watched the video of the incident on 8/17/24. Only part of
incident was on video. The time frame available was 11:53am-
11:58am. In the video Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 are present with
Youth A. They are outside. Youth A was walking in front of all
staff. Staff 3 pushed Youth A from the back twice. After the
second push Youth A turned around and pushed Staff 3. Staff 3
attempted to place Youth A in standing hold but Youth A slipped
out of the maneuver. Staff 3 then grabbed Youth A by the
shoulders and held him, Youth A was able to remove himself from
this hold and grabbed a stick and hit Staff 3 with it across his
body. Staff 3 pushed Youth A to the ground and grabbed and
threw the stick away from Youth A, while holding Youth A onto the
ground. Staff 3 held Youth A down to the ground near his upper
shoulder/neck area. The exact area could not be determined by
video.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• There were no documents of the incident to review.
• Personnel files were reviewed: Staff 2 and Staff 3 had all
the appropriate trainings outlined in the Licensing Rules for
Child Caring Institutions.
• Holy Cross Services Behavior management Policy and
Procedure. Interventions are to be used before a restraint
is deemed necessary.
• Youth A’s intake paperwork reported he was 4’6” and
96lbs.
• HCS Behavior Management Policy and Procedure. The
procedure outlined the following interventions: “treat
persons with respect…do not respond in anger or
frustration…reason with persons served and set clear
boundaries…model appropriate behavior…explain things
on a cognitive level of those in our care, being mindful of
stages of development.”
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Although Youth A was not
following the rules of the program, he was not aggressive in
nature, nor was a threat to the staff involved in the situation due to
his stature. Youth A is considerably smaller than Staff 2 and Staff
3. He is 4 6”, 93lbs and 12 years of age. Youth A only became
escalated after Staff 3 pushed him to the ground multiple times.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 did not use the least restrictive interventions
outlined in the Behavior Management Policy. Staff 3 did not follow
a gradual set of behavior interventions outlined in HCS Behavior
management Policy and Procedure to avoid the use of a restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (1) A child caring institution, including private secure juvenile
Description justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement and
restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(a) Includes documentation of each restraint.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Documentation for the restraint was not completed.
Investigation
7

Staff 1 reported Staff 3 told him not to document the incident
that night. Staff 1 reported there was no logging done on it as
well. Staff 1 reported he did not write an incident report that
night.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report and the logging were requested, however
there was no documentation for the incident.
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. A restraint was completed
by Staff 3. Staff 3 did not document the incident or log it.
Conclusion Violation Established
Criminal History Check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 (4) (a): A person with ongoing duties shall
Section have both of the following:
Description (a) ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Staff 3 does not have the ability to perform his role.
Investigation Staff 1 reported Staff 3 pushed Youth A and completed an
unwarranted restraint towards Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 3
told him not to document the incident in an incident report or
logging that night. Later in the interview, Staff 1 revealed a text
message from Staff 3 to Staff 1 reiterating not to speak to
anyone about the way “he handles kids.”
Both Staff 2 and Staff 3 were administratively placed on leave
after this incident. I attempted phone calls and text messages on
8/21/24, 8/22/24, 9/20/24 and 9/25/24. I did not receive a return
phone call from Staff 3 and Staff 3 no longer works at the facility.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Text message was observed in which Staff 3 told Staff 1
at the end of their shift not to document the incident that
night. Staff 3 also sent Staff 1 a text message on 8/17/24,
“while we are at work don’t you say anything about me
and [woman’s name] and you don’t say anything about
how I handle the kids.”
8

• Ethical Standards of Conduct Policy and Procedures:
“Co-workers are expected to perform their duties to the
best of their abilities in an ethical, diligent, professional,
competent and trauma-informed manner. Co-workers are
expected to be honest and to practice good human
relations in all dealing with supervisors, peers and with
participants and their families. Co-workers are required to
complete required paperwork and service-related
documentation in a timely manner.”
• Youth Recovery Worker-Residential Job Description:
- Provides crisis intervention while upholding fidelity to
program intervention models.
- Ensures all reporting and documentation are
completed…
• Provides immediate, appropriate, and kind redirection
and correction for problematic behaviors among the youth
in the unit…
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule.
• Staff 3 did not conduct himself in an ethical manner, nor
complete his function as a youth recovery worker.
• Staff 3 did not complete paperwork outlined in the
agency’s ethical standards of Conduct, nor as outlined in
his job description. Staff 3 told Staff 1 not to document
the incident in order to hide his behaviors towards Youth
A.
• Staff 3 texted a newer co-worker in attempt to silence him
from speaking about the incident to others.
These actions indicate Staff 3 does not have the ability to
perform the duties of his position.
Conclusion Violation Established
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and an acceptable corrective action plan is requried.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation into Queen of Angels found multiple violations involving the improper restraint and treatment of a youth. Staff repeatedly pushed the youth, used an unsafe and disproportionate physical restraint without following protocol, failed to use de-escalation techniques, and did not document the incident. The investigation concluded that the facility and the staff involved, particularly Staff 3, were culpable for the violations.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violations involve staff-on-youth violence and an unsafe restraint. Staff 3 pushed Youth A multiple times, including pushing him to the ground by his neck/shoulder area, and held him down with force. This physical assault and the use of a non-approved, unsafe physical restraint align directly with the 'Severe SIRs' criteria for 'Safety and Violence' (physical assault, staff-on-youth violence) and 'Restraint and seclusion' (use of physical restraints suggesting excessive force or unsafe de-escalation).
